p: We believed that the patient met the definition of CNS-IRIS. First, the immunodeficient status was obvious during pregnancy in the patient. Second, immune function recovered rapidly after induced labor and effective antibiotic therapy. Third, deteriorated neurologic symptoms and brain imaging were found after treatment in the patient. Fourth, the deteriorated conditions were improved after use of corticosteroids. Fifth, the patient had no evidence of drug-resistant infection, bacterial superinfection, and drug allergy.
